thread.title: Which Princess Diana dresses are on show at the Kensington Palace exhibition?
thread.title_full: Which Princess Diana dresses are on show at the Kensington Palace exhibition?

title: Which Princess Diana dresses are on show at the Kensington Palace exhibition?
text:
Diana's Elvis dress 
Diana dubbed this piece her “Elvis dress” because of its high collar and dazzling finish. 
It was made especially for her by London-based couturière Catherine Walker and worn to the British Fashion Awards in 1989, and again during a visit to Hong Kong. 
The dress is actually two parts: a white silk strapless gown encrusted with pearls and sequins and a matching bolero jacket. GETTY Diana wore the Elvis dress to the British Fashion Awards GETTY Diana's Harper’s Bazaar cover dress 
Diana was photographed in this striking Atelier Versace gown in 1991 by Patrick Demarchelier. 
The portrait, which features the Princess with a defiant hand on her hip and a wry smile on her face, graced the cover of the magazine in November 1997, shortly after Diana’s untimely death. 
The ice-blue silk gown, embellished with golden studs and glass beads, is thought to be the first dress that Gianni Versace made for Diana. 
In 2015 the dress sold at auction for $200,000 (£160,000). HARPER'S BAZAAR Harper's Bazaar used this image shortly after Diana's death GETTY Gianni Versace created the dress for Diana Diana's blue tartan suit 
In 1980 Diana wore a blue tartan Victor Emmanuel suit during a visit to Venice. 
Its dramatic oversized lapel and matching hat make it one of the Princess’s most memorable looks. 
Also featured in the exhibition is Diana's brown tartan suit which she wore during her honeymoon in Balmoral. GETTY Diana wore a blue tartan Victor Emmanuel suit GETTY Charles and Diana were pictured on their honeymoon GETTY Some of Diana's most striking daywear is on exhibit Diana's Catherine Walker evening gowns 
Diana reportedly owned more than 1,000 Catherine Walker outfits, that she collected over 16 years. 
In recent years, the designer has begun dressing Diana’s daughter-in-law, the Duchess of Cambridge. 
Diana look every inch the princess in a blue silk chiffon gown that she wore it to the 1987 Cannes Film Festival, which she attended with a dapper-looking tuxedoed Prince Charles. 
She donned a blue sequinned floor-length gown to a charity ball at Osterly House in Middlesex in 1989. 
Diana wore a simple floral cocktail dress in June 1997, when she auctioned off many of her favourite and most iconic pieces to raise money for charity. 
The auction brought in $3.25 million for cancer and AIDs charities and took place at Christie’s in New York. 
Diana herself posed in each of the dresses for the auction catalogue, as so not to “destroy the magic” of their association with her. GETTY Diana wore this blue gown to Cannes GETTY This is one of Diana's 1,000 Catherine Walker outfits GETTY Diana wore Catherine Walker in New York GETTY Diana's evening gowns are on display at Kensington Palace Diana's Catherine Walker day suits 
The Princess also turned to the designer when she needed more formal daywear attire. 
In 1996 she wore a bold red skirt and jacket while attending the launch of the HIV/AIDs charity London Lighthouse appeal. 
She was pictured in a similar suit a year later, this time in soft pink, at the Savoy Hotel in London. GETTY Diana wore a pink Catherine Walker suit in 1997 GETTY Diana wore this red suit for a charity launch GETTY The bold red suit was one of many by Catherine Walker 
Diana: Her Fashion story opens at Kensington Palace on Friday February 24 and runs throughout 2017. Related articles
